Package gov.nist.timestampingauthority

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.timestampingauthority.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Test class making NTP requests to local TsA server.

    The client assumes the server is serving at port 124 at localhost. Apache Commons NTP implementation has been used.

    Terminal help message: This is an NTP client that requests time from a given port at a specified rate. It logs the received time stamps in a file called 'NAME-millisecondsFrom1970.txt'. In order to start the client, please provide at least the address of the NTP server, e.g. '-a time.nist.gov'. All times are in milliseconds. Please do not group arguments, e.g. '-hap'. To stop the client enter 'stop' during execution. List of commands: -h, --help - display this help message -a, --address - address of the NTP server, can be IP-address -p, --port - port to connect to the NTP server, default is 123 (default NTP port) -r, --repeat - interval between requests to the server, default is 100 -n, --name - name of this client to be used in log file name, default is current machine name -c, --count - number of time stamps to collect before stopping, default is 1000, 0 or negative values mean that the execution can only be stopped manually -f, --file-path - path to a directory to save log file

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Run the client.
        Parameters:
        args - CLI arguments

      • start

        public static void start()
        Start the client by scheduling periodic time requests. Non-blocking.

      • stopAndWrite

        private static void stopAndWrite()
        Stop client, both input thread and request thread are stopped, each time stamps from the server is logged and saved into the file NAME-millisecondsFrom1970.txt.

      • requestTimeAndLog

        private static void requestTimeAndLog()
        Make a request to the specified address. The result of the request is written into the buffer, which is logged into a file when the client is stopped. The client is stopped when count time stamps have been recorded.

      • parseArguments

        private static void parseArguments​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   java.io.UncheckedIOException
        Parse CLI arguments into fields to create a client with needed configuration.
        Parameters:
        args - CLI arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when unknown argument is found, when one of the values is invalid or could not be parsed, when multiple values of the same property were provided, when help message is to be shown, when the property name is present but there is no value after it
        java.io.UncheckedIOException

      • parseProperty

        private static <T> T parseProperty​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> names,
                                   java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,​T> parse,
                                   java.lang.String propertyName)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parse a property with given set of names (-p and --port) and return the value of this property on success. Throw an exception with a meaningful message otherwise. Other exceptions may be thrown by parsing function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the property (e.g., Integer for port number)
        Parameters:
        args - CLI arguments
        names - list of names the property can be referred to (-t and --timeout)
        parse - function taking a string and converting it to a value of the property
        propertyName - pretty name used in error messages
        Returns:
        parsed property value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the same property is mentioned more than once, when the property name is provided, but the value is not

      • readStopCommand

        private static void readStopCommand()
        Run an input loop that waits for "stop" command to stop the client. Any other command result in the corresponding error message and the execution is continued.
